p: Influenza type C infections cause a mild respiratory illness (comparable to other common respiratory viruses) and nearly all adults have been infected with influenza C virus. However, it is milder and rare than either type A or B and does not cause epidemics. The structures of influenza C viruses are different in comparison to influenza A and B. The genera C virion has hexagonal structures on the surface and forms stretched cord-like structures. Influenza C viruses have seven RNA segments, while influenza A and B contain eight RNA segments.
